meanings.definition: Lacking good sense or judgment; foolish.
meanings.sent1: The boy made the foolish decision to jump off the swing.
meanings.sent2: She felt like the foolish girl in the story who ignored the warning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's foolish attempt to catch its tail made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His plan to build a house of cards was the foolish idea of the century.
meanings.sent5: The foolish squirrel thought it could outsmart the clever fox.

meanings.sent1: It was the foolish decision to go out in the storm without an umbrella.
meanings.sent2: The man's actions were the foolish mistakes of a lifetime.
meanings.sent3: The foolish rabbit challenged the tortoise to a race, thinking it would win easily.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness in the face of danger was the foolishness of a brave heart.
meanings.sent5: The foolish knight charged into battle without a plan, leading to his defeat.
